trans-unit.source: The touch keyboard enables text entry for devices that support touch.
trans-unit.target: The touch keyboard enables text entry for devices that support touch.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) text input controls invoke the touch keyboard by default when a user taps on an editable input field.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) text input controls invoke the touch keyboard by default when a user taps on an editable input field.

trans-unit.source: The touch keyboard typically remains visible while the user navigates between controls in a form, but this behavior can vary based on the other control types within the form.
trans-unit.target: The touch keyboard typically remains visible while the user navigates between controls in a form, but this behavior can vary based on the other control types within the form.

trans-unit.source: To support corresponding touch keyboard behavior in a custom text input control that does not derive from a standard text input control, you must use the [**AutomationPeer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209185) class to expose your controls to Microsoft UI Automation and implement the correct UI Automation control patterns.
trans-unit.target: To support corresponding touch keyboard behavior in a custom text input control that does not derive from a standard text input control, you must use the [**AutomationPeer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209185) class to expose your controls to Microsoft UI Automation and implement the correct UI Automation control patterns.

trans-unit.source: See [Keyboard accessibility](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt244347) and [Custom automation peers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt297667).
trans-unit.target: See [Keyboard accessibility](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt244347) and [Custom automation peers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt297667).

trans-unit.source: Touch keyboard and a custom UI
trans-unit.target: Touch keyboard and a custom UI

trans-unit.source: Here are a few basic recommendations for custom text input controls.
trans-unit.target: Here are a few basic recommendations for custom text input controls.

trans-unit.source: Display the touch keyboard throughout the entire interaction with your form.
trans-unit.target: Display the touch keyboard throughout the entire interaction with your form.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your custom controls have the appropriate UI Automation [**AutomationControlType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209182) for the keyboard to persist when focus moves from a text input field while in the context of text entry.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your custom controls have the appropriate UI Automation [**AutomationControlType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209182) for the keyboard to persist when focus moves from a text input field while in the context of text entry.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have a menu that's opened in the middle of a text-entry scenario, and you want the keyboard to persist, the menu must have the **AutomationControlType** of Menu.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have a menu that's opened in the middle of a text-entry scenario, and you want the keyboard to persist, the menu must have the **AutomationControlType** of Menu.

trans-unit.source: Don't manipulate UI Automation properties to control the touch keyboard.
trans-unit.target: Don't manipulate UI Automation properties to control the touch keyboard.

trans-unit.source: Other accessibility tools rely on the accuracy of UI Automation properties.
trans-unit.target: Other accessibility tools rely on the accuracy of UI Automation properties.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that users can always see the input field that they're interacting with.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that users can always see the input field that they're interacting with.

trans-unit.source: Because the touch keyboard occludes a large portion of the screen, the UWP ensures that the input field with focus scrolls into view as a user navigates through the controls on the form, including controls that are not currently in view.
trans-unit.target: Because the touch keyboard occludes a large portion of the screen, the UWP ensures that the input field with focus scrolls into view as a user navigates through the controls on the form, including controls that are not currently in view.

trans-unit.source: When customizing your UI, provide similar behavior on the appearance of the touch keyboard by handling the [**Showing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242262) and [**Hiding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242260) events exposed by the [**InputPane**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242255) object.
trans-unit.target: When customizing your UI, provide similar behavior on the appearance of the touch keyboard by handling the [**Showing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242262) and [**Hiding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242260) events exposed by the [**InputPane**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242255) object.
